intro: Ditremexa nashii, commonly known as the Nash's ditremexa, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
